Description: Application-WebSphereMQ-Instances Template. This is a layer in the WebSphereMQ application, which creates the InstanceProfile, and either Instances OR a LaunchConfiguration, AutoScalingGroup, ScheduledActions, ScalingPolicies and CloudWatch Alarms.

VPCStackName.Description: Name of the CloudFormation Stack containing the VPC
VPCStackName.ConstraintDescription: must begin with an upper case letter and contain alphanumeric characters and dashes.

StandardTopicsStackName.Description: Name of the CloudFormation Stack containing Standard Topics
StandardTopicsStackName.ConstraintDescription: must begin with an upper case letter and contain alphanumeric characters and dashes.

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing KeyPair to enable SSH access to the Instances
KeyName.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing EC2 KeyPair.

Role.Description: Name of an existing Role which provides permissions needed by the Instance
Role.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing Role.

InstanceSecurityGroup.Description: ID of an existing SecurityGroup which controls access to the Instances
InstanceSecurityGroup.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing SecurityGroup.

LogGroup.Description: Name of an existing LogGroup which provides access to CloudWatch Logs
LogGroup.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing LogGroup.

FileSystem.Description: Name of an existing FileSystem which provides shared Instance storage
FileSystem.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing FileSystem.

EnvironmentSize.Description: Size of the Environment to build. Used to select size-related options in Mappings
EnvironmentSize.ConstraintDescription: must be micro, small, medium, large or xlarge.

InstanceOS.Description: The Operating System to use for Instances
InstanceOS.ConstraintDescription: must be AMZN = "Amazon Linux 2016.09.1", RHEL = "RHEL 7.3" or UBNT = "Ubuntu 16.04".

ProductsBucket.Description: S3 bucket containing 3rd-Party Products to be deployed
ProductsBucket.ConstraintDescription: must begin with a lower case letter and contain only lower case letters, numbers and dashes.

ProductWebSphereMQFolder.Description: Folder within S3 bucket containing WebSphereMQ product objects
ProductWebSphereMQFolder.ConstraintDescription: must begin with an upper case letter and contain alphanumeric characters.

ProductWebSphereMQObject.Description: Object within S3 bucket and folder containing WebSphereMQ installer
ProductWebSphereMQObject.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid filename, not containing slashes.

ConfigurationsBucket.Description: S3 bucket containing Configurations to be deployed
ConfigurationsBucket.ConstraintDescription: must begin with a lower case letter and contain only lower case letters, numbers and dashes.

ConfigurationWebSphereMQFolder.Description: Folder within S3 bucket containing WebSphereMQ configuration objects
ConfigurationWebSphereMQFolder.ConstraintDescription: must begin with an upper case letter and contain alphanumeric characters.

ConfigurationWebSphereMQObject.Description: Object within S3 bucket and folder containing WebSphereMQ configuration
ConfigurationWebSphereMQObject.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid filename, not containing slashes.

ApplicationName.Description: Name of the Application associated with the Stack
ApplicationName.ConstraintDescription: must begin with an upper case letter and contain alphanumeric characters.

ApplicationDomain.Description: DNS Name of the Application associated with the Stack
ApplicationDomain.ConstraintDescription: must begin with a lower case letter and contain only lower case letters, numbers and dashes.

UseFileSystemMonitoring.Description: Send EFS NFS Statistics to CloudWatch as Custom Metrics
UseFileSystemMonitoring.ConstraintDescription: must be either true or false.

UseLogMonitoring.ConstraintDescription: must be either true or false.

UseSchedule.Description: Use a Schedule to start and stop the Instances
UseSchedule.ConstraintDescription: must be either true or false.

OnSchedule.Description: On Schedule in constrained Cron format (UTC)
OnSchedule.ConstraintDescription: must follow constrained cron syntax: "0 H * * 1-5", where H = 5-16.

OffSchedule.Description: Off Schedule in constrained Cron format (UTC)
OffSchedule.ConstraintDescription: must follow constrained cron syntax: "0 H * * *", where H = 0-7.

Fn::Join:
[commands]
update_cmd = security
update_messages = yes
download_updates = yes
apply_updates = yes
random_sleep = 10

alias lsa='ls -lAF'
alias ip4='ip addr | grep " inet "'
echo "$(date +'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S,%3N') [DEBUG] Wait for FileSystem DNS name to resolve"
echo "$(date +'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S,%3N') [DEBUG] FileSystem MountTarget not yet available, pausing $delay seconds..."
# 20 is max metric collection size, so we have to submit here
# the next line is the good stuff

[general]
state_file = /var/lib/awslogs/agent-state
[/var/log/messages]
datetime_format = %b %d %H:%M:%S
file = /var/log/messages
buffer_duration = 5000
log_stream_name = {instance_id}
initial_position = start_of_file
log_group_name = /var/log/messages

# Add to RHEL what Amazon Linux includes
# Install EPEL
yum install -y https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-7.noarch.rpm
# Install Python Pip and Python Daemon
yum install -y python-pip python-daemon
pip install --upgrade pip
# Install AWS CLI
pip install awscli
# Download CFN Bootstrap
cd /opt
curl -O https://s3.amazonaws.com/cloudformation-examples/aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest.tar.gz
tar -xvpf aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest.tar.gz
rm -f aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest.tar.gz
# Build and Install CFN Bootstrap
cd aws-cfn-bootstrap-*
python setup.py build
python setup.py install
cd /opt
rm -Rf aws-cfn-bootstrap-*
# Create CFN Bootstrap symlinks
ln -s /usr/init/redhat/cfn-hup /etc/init.d/cfn-hup
chmod 775 /usr/init/redhat/cfn-hup
mkdir -p /opt/aws/bin
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-hup /opt/aws/bin/cfn-hup
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-init /opt/aws/bin/cfn-init
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-signal /opt/aws/bin/cfn-signal
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-elect-cmd-leader /opt/aws/bin/cfn-elect-cmd-leader
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-get-metadata /opt/aws/bin/cfn-get-metadata
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-send-cmd-event /opt/aws/bin/cfn-send-cmd-event
ln -s /usr/bin/cfn-send-cmd-result /opt/aws/bin/cfn-send-cmd-result
# Install the files and packages from the metadata
